This is the worse Router I have ever owned. The stupid thing consistently drops Internet Connection Randomly. If you close your Web Browser, it knocks the computer offline and you go through a constant on and off cycle of internet and no internet. After a week of complete havoc, I had to go back to my Ax4400, and got better quality and stronger signals. Needles to say, this piece of trash is going back and being replaced. And, after 15 plus years of being a TP-Link Customet this piece of trash has convinced me to never buy another TP-Link product again.

Recieved quickly and in good shape, but......Followed the directions to the LETTER!!!!!!! No connection...Went to get on-line help...cut off twice after over 30 min waiting!!!!! Should have statyed with Linksys as their Product support is the best!Do not buy this product!!!

It was working OK in the first 11 months, then suddenly stop working, not powering on at all.I have contacted with both Amazon and TP-Link customer services, no response from them.I guess they do not provide any technical supports

reviewTitle: No Wi-Fi after 9mo, terrible support, do not buy
reviewDescription: Piece of junk. My Wi-Fi stopped working after 9 months. I contacted customer support, was disconnected multiple times and they couldn't suggest anything other than resetting the router. I eventually gave up. I'll never buy another TPLink product again.

reviewTitle: Packet loss much too high, over 6%
reviewDescription: High packet loss, even right near router. Small place, 2 rooms away, owner was getting choppy video, and drop-outs. I'm on ethernet, but my phone tested high packet loss, whereas the Spectrum router always returns a ZERO. Returned.

I bought this as an upgrade/replacement Nov '23 for a LinkSys Wi-Fi router that was still working ok after over 4 years.  Installation was straight-forward.  I preferred the LinkSys app.  The signal strength was good throughout the house,  but my iPhone and iPad would drop and regain WiFi signal periodically.  I never knew if the cause was this router, my VPN or my Apple devices.  Then 4 months after purchase, the router quit working altogether.  In November I thought I had done my due diligence researching wireless routers recommended by independent sources.  I still bought a lemon and am happily back with a new LinkSys router.

reviewTitle: No idea why this is top rated
reviewDescription: This router has not worked right since day one. We have to reset it multiple times a day. Could not handle streaming and locking my car. TV screen would freeze. We thought it was our modem. We got a new one but issues persisted. We plugged our old router back in and now issues have disappeared. Don’t waste your money.
Network port dead. Lesson learned… don’t buy refurbished from amazon as the electronics are not bench tested before resale.

Let me preface this by saying I do have some network setup experience and have a cert for it. Not the best, but better then average capabilities.Had for a month and it keeps dropping internet connection. Wireless is good usually, but if it can't stay connected to internet doesn't do me a lot of good. Had several problems hooking my laptop to it with wifi when the android units were just fine.  Did all sort of if/then things to verify the problems. Checked to verify that I didn't have a scheduled reset, did not. Updated firmware. Turns out the AX21 is just junk. Tp-Link made a couple different version and doing the back and forth shipping to get a good version is just not worth the effort not when the market at this price point is quite full.Probably have to call support and see about RMA. Expecting that since it's been 8 months they're going to find some way to weasel their way out of it.

reviewTitle: Did not work - a warning when they tell you call them prior to returning
reviewDescription: It is always a warning when they talk about contacting them (again and again) prior to returning.  I am not tech unsavy but I tried 5 times to install this device and could not make it work.  I did not contact their help department because it should not be that hard.  And if I ever need to reset it???  Every time the set-up experience was differnt - but it never worked.  I watched the on-line video at least 3 times - I wanted it to work.  But if they made it so complicated that it needs tech support to set up - this is not the device for me.I think that Amazon should do a better job of looking at the products that they offer.

Product worked well for 6 months and then stopped connecting. we didn’t change anything regarding our services. We were getting all of the speed we were paying for. so after troubleshooting with provider and router manufacturer we couldn’t get it worked out. manufacturer wouldn’t back product and didn’t offer any solution other than to purchase new one.

Purchased this for use in a new shop.Bought it in May, worked fine until a week ago, will not connect to any devices, tried using tp link support with no success.. basically received a run around.They won't replace it so I'm out the purchase price terrible cust service and web site is worse.

reviewTitle: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY.....
reviewDescription: Bought this item because of all the statistics and information it promised. I was upgrading my existing wireless router hoping that this on with WiFi 6 capabilities would improve speed and range. Well it's was worse than the outdated one I replaced, streamed a few things fine, but my security cameras would not load and when you ran multiple items, it would drastically slow down. Range was half of what I had and I decided to return this item. Amazon gladly contacted TPLINK in which they agreed to a full refund, I was overall satisfied with the transaction considering it didn't live up to its advertised capabilities. Well when returned the seller hit me with a "restocking fee" which are usually for items that the customer didn't want anymore or have a use for. In my situation, I had a faulty unit that wouldn't perform to is expectation. I spent hours on the phone with no luck. Hopefully your purchase is better then mine, but be aware that if something isn't right with their products or it doesn't operate as it should you will be jumping through hoops to get your money back and you won't get the amount you paid when you do. Good luck!

DO NOT buy this router.  Mine died after 6 months and TP Link did NOTHING to help me fix the problem besides just buy a new one.  The only reason I'm giving this a 1/5 stars is because amazon is making me round up.

I have had this router for 3 weeks and I continuously lose WiFi connection . It’s not my modem it’s the router . Wish I had never bought this and just stuck with my old outdated router which still worked btw way better than this one

Can't setup the unit because the password that came with it doesn't work.  Followed the instructions multiple times.  Found others on the internet with the same issue.  What a waste of time.  I do not recommend fighting with this router.

We have seen some wonderful reviews of this router, and we wish we had similar experiences. However, about every three weeks, the router light turns red, and we have no internet. It is never a simple issue of resetting the modem and router. The Modem always has internet, as I can connect my laptop directly, so the issue is clearly with the router. I have owned this router for about 4 months, and within that time, I have had to contact TP-Link support 3 times and speak to 3 different tech support reps and have them fully rebuilt by Mac address each time. I have spent over 3 hours on the phone with them, plus another 45 minutes with my ISP resetting the Modem. No one has this type of time to spend rebuilding something that should just work, and if it was one time, I would understand. After 3 times, they still would not warranty out the router and told me it would have to happen one more time. It is not like it is not going to happen, and I do not understand why they don't warranty this out because it is clearly not working as intended. I am leaving 1 star because Amazon will not allow me to leave a zero-star review.

reviewTitle: Does not have true access point mode or mesh mode like most tp link routers
reviewDescription: We upgraded to gigabit and tried these to replace ac1200 for better wireless speed. This ax1800 does not have a true access point mode  Would work for an hour or two then tries to become the dns host and crashes the network. Support said to put it in access point mode and it shouldn’t enable dns. Logs showed after about an hour computers and phones were trying to get reservations from this router instead of primary. They did an update that wasn’t publicly available and same thing was happening. They suggested I return these and go with the tp link deco x55 WiFi 6 so trying that. This solution is a bit cheaper and they say it’ll work better. Will review that product once it installs. This would probably work great as a primary router but since it doesn’t function in access point loads as advertised I give it 1/5 stars.

It worked from June 29, 2024 - July 2, 2024. I tried to reset it and reboot it several times. Still no internet. When it did work for 4 days, it was slow, even while only a few feet away. There was a 1-2 second lag between pressing a key (like pause or play) and the action taking effect. What a waste of time, energy, and money. If you order this, do NOT throw away or recyle the packaging. Because you'll want to return it.

I purchased this to replace my 4 year old device due to slowing speeds. What a disappointment. After all the hassle of setting it up I am going back to my old router. The range is absolutely terrible, several devices throughout the home won't even run on it. Save your money, don't buy this router.
It died the same day I installed it. Would not advise. Their customer service was a joke. Luckily Amazon is sending a replacement… fingers crossed it was a fluke.

I suspect my router was a fluke, but it died after just one day of use.It was working REALLY well; VERY fast upload and download speeds (we have a Gigabit fiber optic Internet connection), great WiFi speeds and reliable connections with our tablets and cell phones from ANYWHERE in our home ... and then nothing.I couldn't even log into it (via 192.168.0.1) after numerous resets. No wired or wireless access at all. I couldn't even log into via the app. The front panel lights would come on, but no one was home.I really don't think for a second that my experience is in any way, shape or form a "typical" experience with this router. I really believe it was a total fluke.I've owned TP-Link products for many years and they've ALWAYS provided top-of-the-line performance and reliability! But this one only lasted for one day.We had no power surges or losses of power, and no other electronic equipment shut down, rebooted or stopped working. We have five computers that are constantly running, and lots of other high tech entertainment equipment that's ALWAYS powered on. NOTHING ELSE was effected.My only reason for posting this is to remind everyone that NOTHING is perfect. As much as we'd like to believe that everything we purchase will work and last forever, that's just WISHFUL thinking. I wish it were otherwise.

The setup was easy. However, there is no option to set any of the standard N. America's time zones (Central in my case). As many earlier reviewers indicated, the router constantly requires a restart. Also, as mentioned by others, It looses the connected devices on a regular basis, which, in my case, is several times a day. The strength of the signal is so-so. My house is about 2200 sq. ft. Logging to the device is a challenge each time. After the latest firmware upgrade about 3-4 days ago, I can no longer log in because it does not recognize my password anymore. The so-called "live chat" is just a bot asking you about the problem; after you enter your question, it offers you a bunch of links to their FAQ articles. Unfortunately, I cannot return the router anymore, otherwise, I would do it in a heart bit. Went back to my Linksys. Really wanted this router for the speed and the WiFi6 support, but, turned out, it was a waste of money. Do not recommend this router.UPDATE: It's been about two weeks since I started using my old Linksys AC5400. No disconnects, no router reboots. In my opinion, the TP-Link router has some serious flaws.

Tech support was by chat only.  You wait in a queue forever!  Then you get no help. I was told to watch for a light change on the front of the unit and then contact them again. Nope! Money down the drain.  I will get another brand and hope for the best.

reviewTitle: Not a good product at all
reviewDescription: Don't waste your money. TP LINK HAS BEING A PRODUCER OF BAD PRODUCTS LATELY...  too bad I cannot return this anymore... my advise to everyone do not buy Tp-link products. Pay a bit more and go with a reliable product.

reviewTitle: Warning! WiFi 6 issues!  Skilled support after hours from Shenzhen only!
reviewDescription: I've had the TP-Link AX6000 for several months now.  It worked well out of the box,, but their updates broke it several months ago.  During that time, I've experienced data speed consistency issues on 2.4 Ghz.  5 Ghz is highly unreliable.  The wired connections are fine..  But i paid top dollar for WiFi 6.I've reset and rebuilt it, had my ISP out here a number of times, replaced cables, had a spread spectrum RF analysis performed, etc.  The things I've done and the hours spent on the phone to get this thing to work are extensive.Be aware that there is no skilled US based technical support.  With the US support, I'e been on 2+ hour calls as they script through useless exercises for me to perform.The skilled support is out of Shenzhen China and only available after 9:00 pm.  However,  the language barrier is a real barrier!  Why is it that every email I receive by them has a legal warning about sharing it's content, its just unresolved troubleshooting stuff, nothing proprietary...Two weeks ago today, I went to Best Buy and bought another WiFi 6 router to replace this one.  When I installed the Netgear Nighthawk RAX80 in place of my TP-Link AX6000, all my problems went away.  Its been two weeks today and still no problems at all.My only remaining issue is what to do with the TP-Link AX6000 I spent $$$ on.TP-Link, you're the worst!!!!

reviewTitle: Terrible QoS, latency and non existent support. Avoid if you play games/VoIP
reviewDescription: Bought this router last year and gave it 5 stars after thinking it solved my internet issues. It did not and it basically made them worse with time. Fast forward a few months and the problems were back in full force. The issue? Bufferbloat. Latency. High Ping. Signal Loss.This router does a terrible job of trying to solve Bufferbloat compared to a Netgear Nighthawk R7000P on stock firmware. The QoS on the AX6000 is constantly on and you cannot use basic QoS style rules. Setting something "On" in the device priority option actually makes it even worse. The QoS Bandwidth management barely works, sometimes your speeds will still spike past the number you set. Sometimes the router will be fine, most of the time it's a high ping and high latency mess when it comes to tiny/low latency packets. Gaming, VoIP, etc. Anything like that has trouble with this router. Gaming can be unplayable at times even when it's the only thing connected to the router. Higher pings on this compared to the Netgear due to Bufferbloat.The product description about "Powerful Processing: 1.8 GHz Quad Core CPU and 2 co-processors eradicate latency and deliver stable Performance" is a bunch of bull. The old Netgear has a 1.0 GHz Dual Core CPU with no fancy "co-processors" and it handles traffic far better. The old Netgear also has far better signal coverage compared to this.The best part of this AX6000 is that it reboots fast and your speeds will be consistent.

reviewTitle: Did not work out of the box
reviewDescription: This is the second, TP-link wifi6 router that didn’t work out of the box.  The lights all came on but will not connect to the network.  Now I am having trouble getting my refund and doing battle with Amazon.
This router didn't seem to work right so I sent it back I don't know if it was me or if it just was defective

reviewTitle: Fantastic router but Media Server has issues
reviewDescription: EDITED 4/30/2023Changed my review from 4 stars to 1Have had this router about 3 years now. TP-Link put out a firmware release that broke the routers 2.4Ghz band. I have gone back and forth with their support. Since it is out of warranty they told me the best they can do is give me a 10% discount on a new router. My response to them is that no one spends $300 on a router to have it break in 3 years especially when the reason it broke was because of the new Firmware put out by TP-Link. I have the V1 version of this router and their new firmware (although looks very nice) apparently has issues if you have allot of devices connecting to it.They refuse to acknowledge that they broke it and their investigation into the problem is non-existent. Since their support keeps answering me in extremely broken English I decided it was time to buy a different brand.----This router is most definitely future proof. The interface is very easy to manuever. I was able to create static IPs for all the smart devices in my home (over 30 of them) and then limit the DHCP range above those IPs with no issues. It most definitely has a stronger signal than my old router (Linksys WRT3200ACM).Notes----------------------Has no sorting abilities when look at large parts of information, for example when looking at all the devices that are currently in the system there is no order to it so its hard to see whats going on. Hopefully in a future firmware they add the ability to sort. With smart homes become a thing with LOTS of devices this will be imperative.Cons----------------------Media Server (using the USB) does not appear to work properly. I had a My Book Pro with 4tb connected to it (it worked perfectly fine with my old router). I was able to map drives to it from my PC and see everything but when I turned on the media server it would not pick up any of the images, videos or mp3s that I had on the drive. I had 4 main folders on the drive, the first folder was just my shared drive stuff. Lots of random files PDF, Word Documents etc.... the other 3 folders where spread to "Photos, Music, Videos". For some reason the Media server would scan the documents folder and find some images in there and put that in the photo section and then stop. It would never find anything else and it did not matter what I did it would not work.I ended up selling the My Book Pro and getting a NAS drive that had the media server built into it.Outside of the Media Server it is a great router, really love it.

if you wall mount it it's not ideal. I wish that was made more clear in the description. It is because of the antenna placement. the antennas are awful. they boast 8 antennas but you really can't direct them in any different direction as they will only fold down to the sides. I don't know who thought of this but it's a terrible idea to not be able to make the antennas omnidirectional. the other thing is it's bulky/heavy. in this day and age there's no need for such a heavy router when they could fit that equipment in a smaller version. I usually get nighthawk and I highly regret not continuing with them. I did not return this because I had already mounted it and placed some scratches on the back when mounting - didn't want a partial credit or no credit so it's just a lesson learned. I do not recommend this router. UPDATE: 7/1/24 router had firmware upgrade and now has stopped working all together. tried it support and they couldn't figure it out. spent all day on this. I now absolutely hate this router. * Wi-Fi is mediocre when it works.

The internet worked when cabled to the router, but no wifi signal was available to external devices, such as the phone, ipad, or alexa.  Amazon help said this device required a secure network, and that was the possible problem.  They said this was not a plug and play device.  They also said it could take several hours of a technicians time to correct the problem.  The router packaging was damaged, so I elected to return, as the unit may have also been damaged during shipping.

This was an upgrade from older TP-Link router. After a couple of months, it had intermittent outages (status light goes red). Reboot, work, die. Rinse and repeat. I talked to tech support.They thought it was our service provider.Service provider saw no issues. Then the router worked for a couple of weeks.When it started "going red" again it was multiple times in one day.We worked with service provider and tech support for HOURS and multiple DAYS. Eventually, TP-Link agreed that the problem was the router, which never logged a problem.TP-Link support (it's all email/chat, you can't talk to anyone) said they would replace it.We just got the replacement: a refurb, not new. This was a non-trivially priced router. It died well within the warranty period. And they replaced it with a refurb.I would go so far as to say don't buy TP-Link at this rate.

This product came highly recommended from an internet technician who personally uses this device in his residence.  We were using a Netgear Nighthawk  for a 2500sq ft home. We are not "gamers". We stream music, printer, laptop, home security and personal devices. Immediately connecting this router as per manufacturer instructions, we've had nothing but  little to no service and huge frustration. Customer service from TP Link was not helpful either. After 10 days, I'm ready to sacrifice $80 and seriously consider Starlink.

Just got this router when I had fiber internet installed, and in my office where I am wired in gets great internet, but my phone in the office 5 feet away from the router will show connected with full bars, but there is no internet. I have to manually disconnect and reconnect, and go in the app and test the status of the router to get it to start broadcasting again. Then 1 hour later none of the devices are getting internet again.I also live in a pretty small house (1600 sqft.) and when I am on the other side of the house I am only getting 8-10 mbps when I am paying for 250 mbps. So any shows I stream on the other side of the house buffer and stop working. This is consistent on the 2.4 and 5ghz networks.Overall, very crappy router. Hopefully they can get things resolved for me since my return window just passed on Amazon, but from my research online it looks like there are a lot of others with this issue and have ended up having to eat the cost and buy another. Save yourself the hassle and go with a different brand.

I would send this product back in a heartbeat if I hadn't timed out! This product was marketed as a plug and play replacement for the spectrum installation router. An electronics technician in my family could not make this product work they then called the helpline and were redirected to someone that infected their home computer with a virus and then charge to pay for virus removal on the computer and his phone .we purchased an internet router not a virus causing agent!

reviewTitle: Do NOT believe the Hype - it's BS
reviewDescription: This is more of a rant because of the tons of BS in their promotional info. I decided to purchase this router after ongoing network issues with my Eero router. After many weeks of wasted time and effort, I have realized that these routers will NOT support "large numbers of devices" as advertised. I have a normal number of home devices such as TV, tablets, PC etc. however I also have some 35 smart (IoT) switches around the house. The "support" seemed helpful but their lack of knowledge resulted in a great deal of time and effort wasted.  In the end, I had to separate the IoT devices onto a separate router and bingo, all the issues disappeared. These routers are not as capable as advertised, so unless you have less than about 20 TOTAL wifi devices in your home then you have to buy a more expensive router such as the Deco system. This was the admission I finally received from TP-Link support:  "Unfortunately the Archer AX6000 number of connected clients causes unstable connectivity. Deco system would be better than router. Here are the models you can consider purchasing. Please visit this link for your choices"

reviewTitle: Another Dead In Less Than A Year
reviewDescription: Just like reviewer Crosility, but worse.  First router I could not set up, call tech support and they agreed it was defective and so I returned for another one. After some effort got the second one up, then 7 months latter just failed.  It turns on, I can connect devices to it like TV, but doing the standard connection test it errors out just trying to do basic diagnostics (like the DNS test). I would also say, this was not an easy set up - the Bluetooth did not work for both, I had to get an old Laptop and do a hard link to just to do a normal config.  When it worked, it was great - it is just too unstable and requires too much IT support for a reg home set up.  I will not be getting a thrid

reviewTitle: Wish I had gone a different route(r). Don’t waste your money on this crap.
reviewDescription: I am disappointed with the router. I have 950 mbps up and down when i plug the line directly into my computer. On wifi II barely have 350 up and 250 down (and that is on the 5Ghz) on the 2.4 Ghz i don't break 100 mbps. I thought from reviews I was going to have faster wifi but I guess they were wrong. I can be sitting right beside the router or on the other side of the house and I have the same speeds. Really wish I had gone with a different router, this one is not what I paid for as far as perfomrance.Pic of 2.4 and 5 ghz from 2 feet away with nothing else connected. Cannot get a speed test to load on 2.4 ghz. Total waste of money.Yes the firmware is updated. Don’t waste your money. Wish I hadn’t bought this piece of junk.
This item was sent already opened and used.

reviewTitle: Arbitrarily slows down for no reason
reviewDescription: I bought this to gain the benefit of a WiFi 6 router for my newer devices (computer, phone, etc...). At first it was great, everything was blazing and I was getting the full up and down speed from my ISP. I was noticing slight degradation on upload speeds as time passed, but I thought nothing of it till my work laptop started complaining about limited bandwidth (I have 300/300 from my ISP). As I started to investigate this with my vendor, we narrowed it down to the router being the issue.I looked online and found NUMEROUS complaints about speed slowing down over time. I follow the guides provided by TP-Link to fix this, and upgraded to the latest firmware, which is a tale in of itself. The web interface has a screen for updating the firmware and it was telling me that it was up to date. When I checked the website, there were several new versions of the firmware. I checked my version of router against the firmware and verified that I downloaded the right one. Flashed the new firmware, checked again, and the upload speed is still degraded by 50% of what my ISP will allow.At this point, I am considering replacing it with an ASUS because this is ridiculous. A router THIS EXPENSIVE should NOT have these kinds of issues.My advice, don't buy, find something else.

Router is trash, absolutely refused to connect to the internet. App worked fine setting up. Followed step by step instructions 5x, unplugged and plugged back in 5x, reset 2x, changed ethernet cables, followed troubleshooting steps, nothing. As soon as I unplugged the ethernet cable and plugged it back into my 8year old belkin router internet was up and running again.
Complete garbage. Don't waste your money. The easy hookup app didn't even list this router. When I got it to work it was about 1/8 of the speed it's supposed to be.

reviewTitle: does not work well with spectrum
reviewDescription: doesnt work well with spectrum

In all fairness perhaps I simply got a lemon.I am not new to setting up routers.But I was new to this particular brand of router.I followed the instructions and I could not get any of my computers or mobile devices to see this router.I even used their application and it did not help.So I returned it which went very smoothly.And I purchased a NetGear Nitehawk router to replace the PT.I used their app for setup and everything went unbelievably perfect.My previous router was a Netgear.The Netgear experience was so satisfying on installation that  I believe it’s the only brand I will buy from this point on.Perhaps other people may have had good experiences with the PT router but sadly I did not.
Not sure if it was a coincidence or not but it lasted one week and does not detect any signal from the modem. The setup and directions were decent.

Speeds drop to 1mbs and the internet is just garbage with this router. After a reboot everything is fine for about 12 hours, then you have to reboot it again. See lots of people complaining about this same issue on the TP link support forums with no answers, going back a couple years even.  Throwing this router and my TP extenders in the trash and ordering something else, these are super unreliable.  If you work from home, or want to stream video AT ALL then you should avoid this router.

reviewTitle: This is a Cheap joke of a router. It does not even have IP bandwitch control.
reviewDescription: This is really a joke, not a router. Here is really what you're getting really without their fancy advertising.1) It is NOT for gaming, advanced network setup, nothing. It really has less features, than some of their 40$ models.2) QoS - is a joke. As soon as any NOT prioritized device on the network will open a 1080p video on youtube - it will drop your connection immediately for 1 sec (on a prioritized device!!!!), which is enough to kick you for bad network connection on games like Tarkov for example.3) So you think no problem, I'll just limit the regular user bandwith allocation to lets say 10mbs. Something you can do on their 40$ routers. Guess what, this one DOES NOT HAVE THIS FEATURE. It is a requested feature since 2020, it won't be added, forget about it.So really looking thru all the features.1) QoS is NOT working. Device Prioritization is NOT working. Program Prioritization is NOT working.2) It is a bare router stripped from all its features.3) Signal strength is the same as a Google Wifi 1st gen.For the same price you can get a router that justifies the 200$ price tag. Actually, a lot of routers. If you want this router - don't bother, buy their 80-100$ models - you will get all the same features (working features).

I spent hours trying to set this up. Yes, I updated the firmware.  Yes,  I followed their instructions, and yes, I restarted the computer and reset the modem several times. Even once the router finally registered internet access, the computer (windows 10) would not connect. The TP Link interface would not auto-detect the connection type and still, when that was figured out, ISP loggin entered,  everything was tried. I have fiber optic from ISP, this is NOT my first rodeo! This was ridiculous! You would think for the price they would have this crap figured out. Consider yourselves warned.

reviewTitle: Cannot change SSID, Administrative password change disables all attached device passwords!!!
reviewDescription: It looks like a serviceable router, which I purchased to replace a failed WiFi router. Unfortunately, you cannot change this router's SSID, so most devices on your network will no longer find the Internet. One solution is to set the router SSID to the same one used by the failed router, but this is not an option because it would further break the LAN. In concept, this is easily solved by uninstalling and re-installing the old devices that refuse to connect to the new router. All the old tp-link devices correctly complain that they cannot find the Internet but will not let you tell the tp-link app what the correct SSID is. This is criminally negligent tp-link kasa device design because uninstalling does not clear the device's persistent connection settings so a re-install will resurrect the old, now non-existent router settings. What security holes might this stupidity create?Moreover, changing the router administration app's password, which should've nothing to do with device passwords, breaks the network. Recovering this requires many hours of needless work to reconstruct the network. This device fully complies with my first law of marketing: NEVER, NEVER, NEVER tell the customer what he needs to know to use the product!

I wanted to upgrade my wireless router, so I bought this one.  Set up was ok, but when I went to use wifi calling, that feature wouldn't work.It turned out not to be not compatible with wifi calling for my devices, and it took over ten minutes on customer support to get that information out of the assistant, who apparently didn't understand simple English enough to address my problem instead of reading off of a sheet.  Then he got rude no matter how simple I asked the question!I will give this router to someone who will appreciate it instead of EVER dealing with this farce of a company again.

I wanted to save money of not having to rent from my service package I have so I decided to buy a router. The worst idea ever. These people only care about selling not at all concerned for the buyer. This only works if you are at home but ir you leave your house, no internet at all. We exchanged e mails a few times but they did not understand my need or questions . I asked why did they not make things more clearly in their description and they kept saying the same thing to me until I was getting frustrated and finally they told me this only works inside your house. Why not tell me in the first contact we had? I bought this in 2022. I had been sick and in so much pain on my back, I couldn’t contact them earlier do it was too late to return the products I bought since I though an extender would help but it did not. They were not very nice to say the least, so buyer beware. Good luck.

Setup was easy, tried using TP Links One Mesh with their cheapo extender you can find for under $40 and it randomly dropped to 0.23MB/s every few hours (read: unusable) then it just stopped, my other Netgear router died from getting exposed to the wrath of Zeus and this piece of plastic can't even handle a room at 78F ambient. Pretty disappointing.

reviewTitle: 6 of 8 ethernet ports quit after few months-TP replaced then wifi quit on 2nd one
reviewDescription: This thing is awesome when it works but that seems to be for few months only and then major failures galore and getting it replaced under warranty is a total total nightmare--In fact it is so bad, this router that I paid nearly $300 for I am going to pitch instead of going through India or whatever phone support for hours, constantly on hold to get first one replaced.  If that not bad enough you must mail Router to California and wait for them to receiver before they ship new one--OR--pay for shipping by giving them credit card and they will ship new one right away and then you can ship old one back--I chose latter over phone and then it was days before they shipped my replacement.  BE WARY OF REVIEWS!!!  Most of these are done shortly after purchase--some searching around found many of these routers fail--back to netgear--

reviewTitle: It coulda, it shoulda but it didn't
reviewDescription: The good:Beautiful high-tech piece of equipment - 8 antennas make it look like it could cover several square miles (just kidding.) All kinds of flashing lights and buttons galore. Lots and lots of ethernet ports.Tech help was a mixed bag. TP-Link does respond through chat and telephone support (if you request it enough.) The chat tech support is a joke - with long delays and repeated questions about the product. No help whatsoever. Tried the provided telephone support and it was much better - even though they couldn't solve the problem.The Bad: Did everything according to provided instructions (make sure to download and install the TP-Link Tether app first, before disconnecting from your current internet service.) Everything went according to to directions, until the AX 10000 tried to connect to the internet. Just wouldn't happen. Tried several times with the same result. Spoke to tech and they could not figure out what was wrong. They kept asking who was our ISP. We have a fiber optic cable connection, which may or may not be revelant to the internet connection failure. What ever happened to plug-n-play?

This worked great for two months, and then just stopped working.  The router was connected directly to the internet via ethernet and was working well for two months.  My last TP link (AC 1900) lasted for 4 years, and then just stopped working, and I thought that one should  have lasted longer than that.  But 2 months is not acceptable.

They changed the firmware without notice, after hours searching found out this router no longer supports VPN client, necessary in my application. Sent it back. Company should no bury this information.

I purchased this on April 14, 2021. Finally got around to setting it up in May. It started dropping out every 30 seconds to 1.5 minutes the end of November. So I got around 6 months of it working fine. We contacted customer support at TP Link. Of course, everything is done via email. No phone calls. We had probably 5 or 6 emails back and forth over several days with them asking us all kinds of questions and filling out this and that, do this test, do that test. We did everything they asked. After all that that person was not able to figure out the problem so our "case" was sent up to the next level - trouble shooting person. Again, more questions, tests, forms. Lots of stuff requested that has no relevance to the problem. Again, we did all the tests they asked for. They finally said there is something wrong with our unit and then sent more forms to fill out with lengthy instructions on how to return the product and get a replacement. That's when we found out that they do not replace a faulty product with a new product. They send a refurbished product with a lesser warranty. Unacceptable. I didn't pay full price for a product to only work for 6 months and then receive someone else's faulty, refurbished product. I would not purchase this piece of junk again. Mainly because of the way they handle returns when their product fails. Find a company with a better product and much better customer service. Unless, of course, you're ok with receiving a replacement that's already had problems. Never again will I purchase a TP Link product.

When I got this it would not let my work lap top hook up to the wifi I thought it was my poor internet service so I upgraded my internet service and it still does not work. Of course I can not return it for a different one since it is past the time very disappointed.

This router advertises as being gigabit capable yet it absolutely is NOT. You’re only able to max out a little over 500MBPS. If you have gigabit internet and looking to get the maximum speeds possible, this router is NOT for you.

Worked ok for the first 3 months, then wifi got really spotty, now it’s horrible connection. Bought in February, it’s now July and we need to buy a new one already. Save your money and go with something else

I bought this router to replace a 3-year old router that wasn't giving me full broadband speed.  The LAN features are fine but I never got all my wi-fi devices to stay connected.  I returned this router and bought a Netgear and it worked flawlessly with all my wi-fi devices. I'm an IT guy so I'm pretty sure the problem wasn't the user!

reviewTitle: Claims Supports VPN Client - Does Not
reviewDescription: I ordered two of the AX1800-Archer AX21. One for our home and one for our out-of-state vacation home to set up a VPN tunnel between the homes so that we don't have to have duplicate streaming accounts like Hulu, Netflix, etc. The VPN client at home (Archer AX21 hw version 3.6) works fine with NordVPN. The second router at our vacation home (Archer AX21 hw version 4.6) does not have a VPN client option. After spending over an hour with the TP-Link tech support, the tech informed me that they no longer support the VPN client in hardware versions after version 3.6. The online specs on the Amazon page for this device clearly states that both VPN client and VPN server are available. The client IS NOT.  I'm now scouring eBay to see if I can find an older hw version before version 4 to complete my setup.

reviewTitle: Stopped working with android phones. S21
reviewDescription: Worked fine for 2 months, then Galaxy S21 Phone had an update and now wifi says "connected without internet" on phones. All other electronics are good. I Did a firmware update in the Archer and still no luck.

reviewTitle: Lasted 37 days before it died - Updated several days later
reviewDescription: The speed performance of this router is amazing when the unit was working during the first 37 days. My LAN and WAN ports are not working.  I reached out to tech support and they are having me try some different things to get the router working.  I understand and appreciate that, however, when I connect my old Linksys router to my cable modem and everything is working, then that should eliminate some of the steps we are going through.I have informed tech Support the router needs to be replaced and I'm waiting for a response.8/3/2020What a piece of junk.  The Wi-Fi part works great, but they just cannot seem to figure out how to connect the LAN and WAN ports correctly.  When the first router worked, my speed was incredible.  I was getting the full speed that Comcast said I should and I was thinking about upgrading the modem and Internet package to a full 1GB.  Why not, this router should be able to handle it without problems.  So now my replacement router only connects to the cable modem at 100Mbps Full Duplex.So now I need to decide, do I call tech support for another 4 days of poor service and the run around or do try to get a full refund from Amazon and find another router.  My previous Linksys router (about 10 years old) out performs this broken router from TP-Link.I would not recommend a single thing from TP-Link.

reviewTitle: NO Bandwidth Control! Roommate needs to be throttled
reviewDescription: I've bought this product in June 2021, at the time of this review it is July 2022.Like many, I'm feeling the financial crunch recently. I had to bring in a new roommate in the spare bedroom. Instead of getting a job, he lives off of his limited savings and plays video games all day in his room. He can't be bothered to get a job. I didn't expect to need a bandwidth control feature to throttle anybody when I bought this, but now that I need it, I've found that it doesn't have this feature. I repeat, this "Next Gen" AX6000 WiFi 6 Router(Archer AX6000) does NOT have individual bandwidth control! All it has is a QoS "Device Priority" area where you can lower the speed of the entire network (assuming you're tech savvy enough to input the correct numbers. I've uploaded a pic of how to set it if you want to make your network speeds garbage). But individual connections can't be set. So either every device is cripplingly slow, or none are.I did an internet search on it, TP-Link reps say that they are aware it's a feature that is lacking and have submitted it for implementation. Those posts are years old now. TP-Link clearly isn't going to add the feature.

reviewTitle: Spotty connectivity - Limited range - Cumbersome interface
reviewDescription: - Easy to unpack- The management app is slow and cumbersome but it is serviceable.- WiFi signal is less than expected.  I am comparing to my old eero router. Internet connection is spotty. Frequent pauses in connectivity. I am 100% certain my internet is fine since my TVs are hardwired to my modem and there are no issues there.  The pauses through the router are very frustrating. I replaced the router with an eero router and had no problems. I went through all troubleshooting suggestions for the product. No improvement.Unfortunately I do not live in the US consequently I cannot return. Heading out to buy a new router ☹️☹️☹️

reviewTitle: Router does not work properly, TP Link's Tech Support is a Joke
reviewDescription: After 4 hours with their "tech support" agents (three of them, they kept dropping the chat, so we had to start all over again doing the same steps they give on their website in the troubleshooting video. Even though I told them I did this already, all 3 insisted I do it again. Looks like lots of customers need the video, though. The support agents treated me like an idiot ("did you try refreshing your browser? Do this now, one more time, please."), all but suggesting it was user error, and when that couldn't possibly be the issue, they pointed their fingers at my ISP. I spent 4 hours with my ISP, including paying for a site visit. It wasn't them. It was the router. After 4 hours with TP agents, they gave up and said it must be turned over to their "senior engineers" who would contact me within 24 hours. FOUR DAYS later, an engineer called at dinner time, but I'd already sent the worthless piece of plastic back, and started the refund process. Spend a few extra bucks and get a real router from a real company, like Cisco, or Netgear, not these jokers. Garbage router.
Constantly drops internet coverage. Have tried rebooting, firmware updates etc, and still having issues. Not even worth the cheaper price point.

reviewTitle: Disappointing product and even more disappointing support
reviewDescription: The Product:Just over two years after purchase this product is completely useless. A few weeks ago I began having intermittent outages with my internet. After eliminating my isp and modem as the issues I was able to determine my router was causing 100% packet loss making me unable to even load a web page.Support:While talking to support I tried several of their suggested fixes and provided them with the serial number and date I purchased my router from Amazon. Support told me they would like to end the chat, search for a solution on their own and contact me via email. I received an email saying TP would be sending me a replacement after I provided them with my serial number and invoice. I did and the next day I received an email saying I would not receive a replacement because the router was no longer under warranty. I had already provided that information initially, never asked for the replacement, but they told me I was getting on.I responded letting them know I was dissatisfied with the series of interactions and they replied offering me 10% off of a new router of my choosing from an authorized retailer. I sent them a link for an ax80 from Amazon which was listed at $229.99 and currently running a $20 off coupon. They replied saying that since the router was already on sale they could not give me a code for the 10% they offered and I could chose another one. I realize it’s only a few dollars difference, but that’s besides the point. In the end their “solution” to retain a loyal customer who had become dissatisfied with their product and support was to a) take back their 10% offer and have me accept the 8.7% everyone was receiving or b) have me select a product I dont even want to get 10% off.Because of all of this I have been stuck using this unreliable, at best, router for an additional week thinking they would do right by me. Do yourself a favor and avoid this product and company.

reviewTitle: Pass it up, Buggy. Maybe I'll get a AX router in a few years
reviewDescription: I was super excited to get this router, though hesitant. I have bought 1 other TP-Link product, and the quality on that was really lacking I felt. But I figured its been a few years, and this is their HIGH end gear.I love the router I have, but I have a galaxy s10+ and would love to be an early adopter of Wi-Fi 6 and get the full potential speeds of my Gigabit Fiber internet. Well, sadly that didn't work outQuick rundownPros;The most simple and flawless setup I've ever had with a router. The Teather app is super easy to use. I had it up and running the latest firmware in 5 minutes.Wi-Fi Range and speeds are phenomenal on my Gigabit connection*Web interface is very expansive, with lots of options under advanced for those who care.Cons;**please note all of these issues never happened on my other router (Linksys EA9300 Max-Stream) So it is not a hardware issue or issue with my internet service**VERY unstable performance. Works good for 5 minutes then starts to get unstable. If I reboot it works ok again for a bit, etc.Wired connections don't run as well as you'd thinkFile transfers were all over the place, and not consistent. Ping was not as stable as id like, lots of jitter too.Web-pages loaded quickly, but strangely streaming videos I had issues. They buffered a lot, and lots of frames were dropped. Some would glitch out and I'd have to restart the page.Wi-Fi had good speeds but videos also took slightly longer to buffer vs my old router.I dropped frames, which never happened before either. I even had issues when streaming 4k, like some how the packets my phone received were corrupt somehow. (which went away when I switched back to my other router)Like others, my apple products preformed much slower on this router. My iPad mini use to get 550+mbps with my Linksys, with this router it dropped down to 150mbps, and preformed noticeably slower. The backwards comparability was not an improvement or the same as AC routers, but a step back.NO WAY TO DISABLE QOS settings, which I have theorize may be a big cause of the issues. (ever router I've Tried QOS on made performance buggy and unstable. If you know what I mean, you'll totally get it)So all in all, I'm going to have to return this, which is a shame.IDK if its that Wi-Fi 6 needs some more time to mature, If this is a low quality product, or if TP-Link is not a good company (maybe a little of each)...But it appears I should have went with my gut and waited for a brand I trusted more to release gear. But the deal they were running was too tempting...So folks, I would steer clear of this one, even for a good deal, and go with a more stable router.

reviewTitle: Not very good if it won't stay powered on
reviewDescription: This review is for the TP-Link AX1800 WiFi 6 Router (Archer AX21).  I also have the AC1750 TP-Link router that I bought a few weeks ago and have had no problems with it, which is why when I needed another one I bought this one since it was an upgraded model. It looked good out of the box and I got it booted up and on my network and started going through the set up. While I was doing this I had to move it closer to the network connection so I could plug in the computer I was using on the 192.168.0.1 network to access setup.When I did, it powered off. I only moved it 3 feet and didn't unplug the power or WAN cable. I had to unplug it and plug it back in a couple of times before it powered up. I had to restart the setup sequence again. While going through the setup it powered off a couple more times but finally it stayed up long enough for me to get the setup completed and able to connect my laptop to it over wireless. I was careful not to move any cables while doing this.After I was finished testing the wireless I picked up the router and it powered off again. I wiggled the power connection going into the back of the router and the light finally came back on and it booted up.  After it booted up I lightly pushed against the connector plug and it powered down. It took some wiggling of the connector and pulling the plug out and putting it back in a few time to finally have a light come back on. Obviously there is something wrong with the plug or the connection inside the unit that causes it to lose power when it's moved a little bit. It's being returned tomorrow and I've not decided yet if I'll try another one or look for a different brand.

reviewTitle: Terrible. Awful. Unreliable. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
reviewDescription: This router dropped connection more times than I can count. I used it for a little over a week. I kept thinking “maybe it’s just a freak thing and it’ll correct itself”. Nope.I work in cybersecurity and work remote a lot of the time. I need a stable and reliable connection. This router did not provide it. My default router that my ISP provided performs better than this. If you know anything about routers, you know That’s saying something.I did troubleshooting for hours on end and nothing changed. I finally had enough and sent this back to Amazon and asked for a refund.DO NOT waste your money. Get a Nighthawk or something else. I’ll even recommend your ISPs router over this cause that’s what I went back to using for the time being.

After configuring my TP-Link AX1800, the router started rebooting itself by random after only 36 hours of use...tried multiple times to update firmware and factory reset the unit but to no avail. Have been using other TP-Link product for years including an AC1750 router which I absolutely love, so I was a bit surprised at how unreliable this product was.I've initiated a return of this router but I will not be replacing it with the same model. Aside from the reliability issue I found one thing I absolutely hate about it. The web UI.I use DHCP reservation, meaning I assign specific IP addresses to the corresponding MAC addresses on my devices...I keep a separate list of these MAC addresses in plain text.The DHCP reservation section of the TP-Link AX1800 is different from other TP-Link appliances I've used. YOU CAN ONLY CUT AND PASTE MAC ADDRESSES IN TWO DIGITS AT A TIME! Let me repeat that: TWO DIGITS AT A TIME...a MAC address contains TWELVE hexadecimal digits. So I have to break up a single MAC address for cut and paste SIX TIMES. Multiply that for every device you want to reserve DHCP addresses and you're looking at a world of inconvenience.What were these people thinking? It's already cumbersome to manually type in MAC addresses, so why take away full cut and paste functionality from your UI? The TP-Link AC1750 isn't limited like this...entering MAC addresses takes up a single field, not like the TP-Link AX1800 which breaks up MAC address into six two digit fields. Even my much older Netgear N300 allows full cut and paste of MAC addresses.Again, I've used many TP-Link products in the past, and up until today I actually preferred them over other manufacturers. So this AX1800 router surprises me: it is both unreliable and a pain to configure, and as such I don't know if I will be going with TP-Link again.

The bottom line is this .... the Archer AX21 router does not provide a reliable internet connection.At first, everything worked as advertised.  I unboxed the AX1800 router and connected it to my desktop computer using the included ethernet cable. Then I configured the router using the router's webpage interface to set up the SSID & password, and other necessary configuration settings.  After saving the settings, I powered down the router and connected the AX21 to my Spectrum cable modem.  At this point the WiFi connection was solid, and download speed and WiFi signal strength was good.  As recommended by TP-Link, I updated the router firmware successfully, turned off automatic firmware updates, saved the settings and rebooted the router. Everything was still working fine .... at least for a while.After I had been using the AX21 for about two weeks, things took an abrupt turn for the worse!  I was watching Netflix, and suddenly the movie stopped playing and an error message showed up - no internet. So reset the AX21 and continued watching the show. The next day it happened again - three internet disconnects over a wired ethernet connection from the TV to the router!  And two days later, when I was using my desktop computer on a WiFi connection, I had to remotely reset the router several times to re-establish my internet connection. The WiFi signal remained strong, but there was no internet connection. Tried replacing the ethernet cable from the modem to the router, but this didn't resolve the problem.So after this disappointing turn of events, I disconnected the AX21 router and installed an old Netgear router that I used to use 10 years ago .... and the dropped connections stopped happening!  So the problem was definitely caused by the TP-Link router.This prompted me to check the reviews that other people had posted for the AX21, and I found that other people were also having the same random disconnect problems!  So I decided to return the router to Amazon for a refund.If you absolutely have to have a reliable internet connection for your home or business, I suggest that you stay away from this TP-Link router .... it is not trustworthy!

Purchased this router and an extender hoping it would be better than the rental equipment of big DSL company months ago but life happened and I’m past the return date of course. I finally managed to hook it all up and even successfully depending on how define it got things going using it.Several hours later though and I’m noticing it’ll drop connection frequency which is a pain on iPhone trying to figure out the other issues also happening with the TV trying to connect.I have a smart tv from Amazon and initially it was actually working as it should but for whatever reasons it now tells me “Parental control restrictions; Not allowed to surf internet during this time”. And no I have not turned any parent controls on for any devices in my life but I check in case and nothing to be found online or app. This is turning into being more complicated than it should be but as expected from these “type” of products. If I figure it out tomorrow I’ll revise review but after that I’ll trash it and not purchase from this company again.

reviewTitle: UPDATE: Purchase Twice, Broke Twice. BEWARE.
reviewDescription: This product stopped working completely after only 6 weeks. The WAN port just stopped receiving internet signal one day. I exhausted all of the troubleshooting that I knew and even worked with my internet service provider to confirm that nothing on their end was wrong. Nope. The router just STOPPED WORKING randomly.I couldn't return it at that point so I tried working with their support to get a replacement or a refund. THEIR SUPPORT IS AWFUL. I have an email chain 10+ messages long back and forth where I repeat over and over all of the things I did to fix their crappy router. After over a week of back and forth we just bought a different router and hoped that they would eventually send a replacement. Life got busy and they were so TERRIBLE at helping that they just closed my ticket.It's a matter of principle at this point that they do the right thing and take responsibility for their bad product. I would chuck the thing in the trash if I could. Seriously, you should consider purchasing from a different company. Just know that if you run into problems with your router...your basically out of luck because their support is miserable.UPDATE: The second router (same model) that I purchased has also stopped working. I am LIVID. It slowly stopped being able to connect with my work laptop, then an Alexa echo. I had IT folks from my work and from Amazon providing assistance. I rebooted these devices. Nope. It was the router. Again. I want to smash this thing with a hammer and set it on fire. I HATE this model of router. I thought TP Link was supposed to be a good brand? I'm so angry. It had cost me DAYS of working time troubleshooting and trying to reconnect. I don't even want to contact support because it was traumatizing last time.

reviewTitle: Poor Warranty and Poor customer service
reviewDescription: After 5 months the router stopped emitting.  Things happen.  Notified the company and originated the return process.  It's common, they want you to go through the steps, did you do this, do that, I get it.  Finally, they will send a replacement.  I was required to pay $14.99 for the replacement shipping.  In addition, no where in their correspondence did they indicate they were enclosing a return label.  So I sent back by USPS.Received a "refurbished" router along with a return shipping label.I have requested a refund for my shipping cost.  Enclosed their email correspondence that reflected no instructions regarding a return label.No real customer service, gives you the feeling that they don't care to retain you as a customer.All this has taken way to much time.  I won't be doing business with them again.

reviewTitle: Frequent disconnection right after the return policy ended.
reviewDescription: Disconnection several times per day and the connection never comes back until the device is rebooted.Customer service suggested unreasonable resolutions a couple of times for a month. At third chat for support, they asked me to upload multiple photos instead of typing information they want. Finally they approved replacement and I had to upload those photos again on their product registration website after chatting. Of course, RMA process is not customer friendly. Customers first should pay cost for shipping and replacement unit. If the defective unit is not delivered to them within 25 calendar days, they will not give you the credit back for the replacement unit.
